form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mrs. Fischer introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation

form.official-title: To improve the transparency of Amtrak operations, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Amtrak Transparency Act.
Section 24302 of title 49, United States Code, is amendedâ€”

paragraph.text: in subsection (a)(6), by striking in an open meeting; and
by amending subsection (e) to read as follows:
A majority of the members serving on the Board who are eligible to vote shall constitute a quorum for doing business.

subparagraph.text: Not later than 30 days before convening any meeting of the Board, the Board shall post, on a publicly accessible website, an announcement of the meeting that includes the anticipated agenda for the meeting.
All meetings of the Board shall comply with the requirements set forth in section 552b of title 5.

paragraph.text: Not less frequently than annually, the Board shall convene a meeting to which the head of the Department of Transportation of each State traversed by a long-distance route or State-supported route, or the designee of such State official, shall be invited to participate.

section.text: Section 24303(b) of title 49, United States Code, is amended by striking The preceding sentence and inserting Amtrak shall publicly disclose the amount of each discretionary bonus paid to any officer or non-bargaining unit employee. The 2 preceding sentences.

Section 24315(h) of title 49, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following: Upon request, Amtrak shall disclose to a State or the State-Amtrak Intercity Passenger Rail Committee, any vendor agreement valued at not less than $250,000 for services procured to implement a service on a State-supported route..
